document.docTitle: Pagurixus paulayi Komai & Osawa 2006, n. sp.
document.masterDocTitle: A review of the Pagurixus boninensis species group, with descriptions of six new species (Crustacea: Decapoda: Anomura: Paguridae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the Pagurixus boninensis species group, with descriptions of six new species (Crustacea: Decapoda: Anomura: Paguridae)

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Natural History Museum and Institute, Chiba, 955 - 2 Aoba-cho, Chuo-ku, Chiba 260 - 8682, Japan.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
HOLOTYPE : UF 7301 , male (SL 2.1 mm ), Luminao Reef , Guam , Mariana Islands,
2.1–2.4 m
, coll. F. Schroeder ,
7 May 1998
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
PARATYPE : UF 7302 , 1 male (SL 1.7 mm ), Cocos Barrier Reef , Guam ,
10–15 m
, rubble field, coll. G. Paulay ,
19 May 1997
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 33.
Pagurixus paulayi
n. sp.
Holotype male (SL 2.1 mm) from Guam (UF 7301). A, shield and cephalic appendages, dorsal view; B, left antennule, lateral view; C, ultimate segment of left antennular peduncle, ventral view; D, left fourth pereopod, dactylus and propodus, lateral view; E, same, mesial view; F, sixth thoracic sternite, ventral view (damaged); G, coxae of fifth pereopods and eighth thoracic sternite, ventral view; H, telson, dorsal view. Scale bars: 0.5 mm.

FIGURE 34.
Pagurixus paulayi
n. sp.
Holotype male (SL 2.1 mm) from Guam (UF 7301). A, chela of right cheliped, dorsal view; B, entire right cheliped, mesial view; C, same, lateral view; D, carpus of right cheliped, dorsal view; E, chela of left cheliped, dorsal view; F, entire left cheliped, mesial view, G, same, lateral view; H, carpus of left cheliped, dorsal view. Scale bar: 0.5 mm.

FIGURE 35.
Pagurixus paulayi
n. sp.
Holotype male (SL 2.1 mm) from Guam (UF 7301). A, right second pereopod, lateral view; B, left third pereopod, lateral view; C, right second pereopod, dactylus and distal part of propodus, mesial view; D, left third pereopod, dactylus and distal part of propodus, mesial view. Scale bars: 0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Colour in life. Chelae and ambulatory legs generally purple (according to the field note by G. Paulay).

As mentioned above,
P. paulayi
n. sp.
is similar to
P. boninensis
,
P. festinus
and
P. ruber
n. sp.
The spinulose right chela is characteristic for
P. paulayi
n. sp.
Furthermore, the ventral series of setae on the ultimate antennular segment, which do not form distinct tufts, distinguishes
P. paulayi
from
P. boninensis
and
P. ruber
n. sp.
Pagurixus paulayi
differs from
P. boninensis
in lacking the male left gonopore and from
P. ruber
in the possession of a prominent ventromesial protrusion on the right coxa of the fifth pereopod in males. The general color of
P. paulayi
in life is purple, differing from that of
P. boninensis
or
P.ruber
.
This species is dedicated to Dr. Gustav Paulay of the Florida Museum of Natural History, for his enormous effort to document marine biodiversity of Guam Islands.
